hanzi-su-wiki:
徴

Значения

Знак, симптом, примета; собирать, созывать; доказывать, звать

Мнемоника

Бить 又 верхушки 山 растений (стебли) палкой и топтать ногами 彳. Плохая работа — хозяин 王 созывает работников и требует отчета.

Варианты

徵, 征

zhēng

Японский вариант 征

徴徴RS
徵徵		summon, levy, ask, sign

koohiiStory1: If you see a column of kings being marched up the mountain under a taskmaster´s whip... indications are, there has been a coup.
koohiiStory2: All indications are that the taskmaster´s son is going to be king of the mountain soon …　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　チョウ 象徴　しょうちょう(symbol)…　　　　Pure Group:　懲888.
jp_example_words:
象徴(しょうちょう): symbol
徴収(ちょうしゅう): collection, levy
特徴(とくちょう): feature, characteristic
WaniKani_Radicals: 彳, 山, 王, 夂
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A loitering mountain king in the winter is an indication or sign of something to come.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: We don't want to focus too much on what the indication / sign actually is, though, because it will take away from the indication part (which we want to remember). So, focus on the fact that this is some kind of indication that's important, but you don't know what that indication means or is... because we'll use that with the reading.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When you spot a loitering mountain king in the winter, you know it's an indication that soon Mrs. Chou (ちょう) will appear. It's like a Groundhog's Day kind of situation, but instead it means Mrs. Chou is about to come out, perhaps early for the season.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine an announcer watching the loitering mountain king, "There he is... and it's still winter. We all know what that means. It's a sign that Mrs. Chou will be coming out of hibernation soon." Then, you can imagine her bursting forth from the mountain, running down her street.
Ru_Meaning: indications, sign, omen, symptom, collect, seek, refer to, question
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 微 (かすか、ビ мельчайший).

Compound 徵 mutant 徴 (seal-variant 𢾷) from road-left 彳 chì and related phonetic person-calling 𢽠 zhēng and (not- 微 wēi) A326 征[徵] simp 征 --1988 𢽠 (exception- 宫商角徵zhǐ羽). (name- person-calling 𢽠 zhēng)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
originally a woman 女 with long hair calling someone.

existing-char phonetic-phonetic 正𢽠 征 (go on a journey) 徵 (a sign) retro exception (宫商角徵zhǐ羽)

Variant rule : C000

zhēng, zhǐ
яп. вм. 征
Radicals: 彳, 山, 王, 夂  (loiter, mountain, king, winter)
Meaning Mnemonic
A loitering mountain king in the winter is an indication or sign of something to come.
We don't want to focus too much on what the indication / sign actually is, though, because it will take away from the indication part (which we want to remember). So, focus on the fact that this is some kind of indication that's important, but you don't know what that indication means or is... because we'll use that with the reading.
Reading Mnemonic
When you spot a loitering mountain king in the winter, you know it's an indication that soon Mrs. Chou (ちょう) will appear. It's like a Groundhog's Day kind of situation, but instead it means Mrs. Chou is about to come out, perhaps early for the season.
Imagine an announcer watching the loitering mountain king, "There he is... and it's still winter. We all know what that means. It's a sign that Mrs. Chou will be coming out of hibernation soon." Then, you can imagine her bursting forth from the mountain, running down her street.
